abstract:
On basis of laboratory examinations indicators from a total of 620 samples, a machine learning-based diagnosis model was developed, and subsequently implemented as a COVID-19 diagnosis aid APP. External validation showed satisfiable model prediction performance (i.e., AUC= 0.872) which guarantees the promising use of this tool for extensive screening.
Competing Interest Statement
The authors have declared no competing interest.

author: Minjin Wang; Yongzhao Zhou; Yi Zhou; Yanbing Zhou; Qingfeng Li; Mengjiao Li; Zirui Meng; Binwu Ying; Xingbo Song; Weimin Li; Huan Song; Xiaojun Lu; Shuo Guo
title: Development and utilization of an intelligent application for aiding COVID-19 diagnosis
